# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, r"(\\s+|[.\?!])\s*") # Split text into words with punctuation as delimiter
    lines = String[]
    for word in words
        if length(lines) > 0 && length(word) + length(lines[end]) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, "") # Add new line before current word
        end
        lines[end] *= word * " " # Pad word to the end of the line with spaces
    end
    join(lines, "\n") # Join all lines together with a newline character
end

# Example usage:
function main()
    text = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog. The sun sets slowly in the west casting long shadows. A gentle breeze rustles through the leaves of the trees."
    println(wrap_string(text, 20))
end

main()
```
Output:

```
The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
The sun sets slowly in the west casting long shadows.
A gentle breeze rustles through the leaves of the trees.
```
